title: Episode 59 - "Toast"
synopsis: Space Ghost shares a love of grilled bread products with returning guest Merrill Markoe, and seeks advice from "Loveline" co-host Adam Corolla.

transcript.speaker: Choose a format
transcript.dialogue: Regular Table Indented Condensed

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Boys, this is it: I'm in love.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: With us?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: No, with Merrill. (slurps coffee) I'm not sure if I remember how to behave around women of the opposite sex. Questions, comments?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (blinks)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Oh, uh, take your shirt off.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (giggles) Yeah, take your shirt off and chase her around. (Zorak and Moltar snicker)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I can see I'll need to bring in an expert. Moltar, book Lee Majors.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (invisos in to set) Greeting! I'm Space Ghost. Zorak, you've got something on your face. Oh, it's your nose! (laughs to himself) Moltar, you also have something on your face. Oh, it's your breathing recepticle! (laughs) (invisos to desk) I'm playful because I'm so deeply in love. My guests tonight include the ravishing radiant and most resplendant lady ever to grace this desperate lonely hovel, writer Merrill Markoe. As well as Hollywood's leading love authority Lee Majors. (looks at his card) Moltar, we can't have Lee Majors in here pawing my precious Merrill. What were you thinking?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: We can't get him anyway. How about Adam Carolla?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Um, Hollywood's leading love authority, Adam Carolla. Zorak, play me to the desk.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: You're already at the desk.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Oh yeah. I must be crazed with desire. Moltar, bring in my first desk.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: This woman, she means a lot to you, huh?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, Zorak. I'm the happiest I've been since my action series days. She... completes me.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Interesting.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Why is that interesting?

transcript.speaker: Adam Carolla
transcript.dialogue: Space Ghost!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Greetings, Adam! How ya doin'?

transcript.speaker: Adam Carolla
transcript.dialogue: I'm well, thank you.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: And, thank you for agreeing to help me get some advice for my rendezvous with Merrill.

transcript.speaker: Adam Carolla
transcript.dialogue: Well, it is part of my job, y'know.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Yeah right. Adam, love is the universal language, and seeing as I'm not from your universe, I need your help. Will my relationship with Merrill suffer because of our differing gravitational backgrounds?

transcript.speaker: Adam Carolla
transcript.dialogue: No, uh, although I don't believe your refractory period is quite as long in the absence of gravity.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Refractory period...

transcript.speaker: Adam Carolla
transcript.dialogue: I believe even superheroes have refractory periods, don't they?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Mm. (flies off to control room)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (laughing at program)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Is she here yet?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Nope. (continues laughing)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: What's a refractory period?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (perturbed) I'll show ya later.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (bounds back to desk) Maybe you should explain what you're talking about to some of our less sophisticated viewers.

transcript.speaker: Adam Carolla
transcript.dialogue: Well, that is the time between hugging your partner...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You know, Adam, I can hug all night.

transcript.speaker: Adam Carolla
transcript.dialogue: Although I never see you with any women.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: What do you mean? Women are all over me like proton shields on the lost city of Guf.

transcript.speaker: Adam Carolla
transcript.dialogue: But yet you go home from the studio each night alone.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I have my puzzles.

transcript.speaker: Adam Carolla
transcript.dialogue: But you can't squeeze puzzles.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You could squeeze puzzles.

transcript.speaker: Adam Carolla
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, but the covered bridge you just made would break and go into a million pieces, and you'd have to rebuild it again, on your lonely kitchen table.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Not if you laminate 'em.

transcript.speaker: Merrill Markoe
transcript.dialogue: You know what, Moltar, I would like to say that I know, not only do I know Letterman, you know, I know Jay Leno. And I would recommend that if you will allow me to intercede on your behalf, I can try and get you a job with Jay Leno.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Would I be allowed to bring my oily directing rags?

transcript.speaker: Merrill Markoe
transcript.dialogue: Oh, absolutely, you can bring all the flammables you like.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (in background) Oh, hi Merrill!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Uh oh. (clears his throat) So, yeah, hang on while I go let Space Ghost know that you're here.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Moltar, why didn't you tell me that Merrill was here?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Merrill's here.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (angry) Thanks for the update, Geraldo! Now send her in, ya dumb clown, and don't screw it up or you're dead! (cheerful) See you out there, Merrill!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (bounds back to desk) Okay, Adam, that's all the time we have, thanks for stopping by.

transcript.speaker: Adam Carolla
transcript.dialogue: (pause) You're on the Cartoon Network, right?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You know, that's really a Moltar question, hang on and I'll transfer you. (blasts Adam off the monitor) (smells his breath) (hmmm, minty or mediciney? oh, i can't tell!) My next guest is a very special lady. (taps cards) She means the planet to me, and we couldn't be happier together. Miss Merrill Markoe!

transcript.speaker: Merrill Markoe
transcript.dialogue: (stares at Space Ghost)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Well, here we are. Together at last.

transcript.speaker: Merrill Markoe
transcript.dialogue: (continues staring)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You... and I. Together at last.

transcript.speaker: Merrill Markoe
transcript.dialogue: Ah ha, is this the beginning of the interview?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You like toast?

transcript.speaker: Merrill Markoe
transcript.dialogue: Hm?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Do you like toast?

transcript.speaker: Merrill Markoe
transcript.dialogue: No.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: We have a lot in common. Right, uh, don't we? Y'know, because, uh, because of the toast and all?

transcript.speaker: Merrill Markoe
transcript.dialogue: (stares)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Uh... (pounds his desk four times) Pardon me, Merrill, I think someone's at my door.

transcript.speaker: Merrill Markoe
transcript.dialogue: You're, you're gonna take off in the middle of MY interview, and, and answer the door?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Yup. (flies off)

transcript.speaker: Merrill Markoe
transcript.dialogue: (shakes her head, rolls her eyes)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: So, do you come here often?

transcript.speaker: Merrill Markoe
transcript.dialogue: I've been on before, you don't recall?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Oh yes, how could I forget? It must be wonderful to be so talented and yet, so beautiful.

transcript.speaker: Merrill Markoe
transcript.dialogue: (smiles, blushing)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: By the way, I love your body... of work.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Help me, Adam, I ran out of things to talk about.

transcript.speaker: Adam Carolla
transcript.dialogue: Oh.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I think she may be intimidated by my remarkable physique.

transcript.speaker: Adam Carolla
transcript.dialogue: Uh, women, uh, want, they like a humbler man.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Humbler, eh?

transcript.speaker: Adam Carolla
transcript.dialogue: Yeah.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Well, then I shall unleash a firestorm of humility the likes of which this universe has never seen! (flexes his bulk)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: ... and when I'm not making cheese, I spend a lot of my time line-dancing.

transcript.speaker: Merrill Markoe
transcript.dialogue: Would you be willing to dance with me?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Oh, you bet.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (bounds to desk) Merrill...

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Shh! Shh!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Merrill, have I ever told you about how I'm not amazing?

transcript.speaker: Merrill Markoe
transcript.dialogue: You mind if I ask you a personal question?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Oh, not at all. We should get to know each other better.

transcript.speaker: Merrill Markoe
transcript.dialogue: I'm wondering whether or not, are you married?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Not yet, my pretty pony.

transcript.speaker: Merrill Markoe
transcript.dialogue: Hm, interesting.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Why is that interesting?

transcript.speaker: Merrill Markoe
transcript.dialogue: I don't know, I don't know, I don't see any, are there any females on your show at all? I've never seen a female on your show.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Uh, you're on...

transcript.speaker: Merrill Markoe
transcript.dialogue: Besides me, but I mean, in the group that participates in the show, you have that, that...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Zorak's a woman, aren't you... honey?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Nope. I'm all man, AND I can prove it. (sound of garments rustling off-camera)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Sit down, ya crazy broad! (blasts Zorak) (laughs) Women!

transcript.speaker: Merrill Markoe
transcript.dialogue: So, you don't have any women at all, on your show?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: What are you getting at?

transcript.speaker: Merrill Markoe
transcript.dialogue: Well, it just strikes me as being... you know, very...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Macho?

transcript.speaker: Merrill Markoe
transcript.dialogue: Well, no.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: What then?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Confused.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (pounds desk four times again) Pardon me, Merrill, I think someone's at my door. (flies off)

transcript.speaker: Merrill Markoe
transcript.dialogue: Aw, geez...

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Merrill, I'm sorry, and I don't know why he's treating you this way. He should be asking you about your new book!

transcript.speaker: Merrill Markoe
transcript.dialogue: (holds up her book) "Merrill Markoe's Guide to Love". I bet it's pretty interesting.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: It looks fascinating. Like you, Merrill. (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Merrill Markoe
transcript.dialogue: (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Adam, she's slipping through my fingers! What do I do?

transcript.speaker: Adam Carolla
transcript.dialogue: Hmmm...

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Beat it, simpleton! (throws lever, Adam disappears)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Moltar, what are you doing?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: You don't need that guy, Space Ghost. I know how women work.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You do? Tell me!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Okay, now listen up.

transcript.speaker: Merrill Markoe
transcript.dialogue: Do you like dogs? I got, I, I need to know. I mean, if we're gonna, you know, spend time together, I need to know if you like dogs.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Do I like dogs?! I love dogs! Why, do you have a dog?

transcript.speaker: Merrill Markoe
transcript.dialogue: My dog Louis. (shows picture)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Oh, he's darling!

transcript.speaker: Merrill Markoe
transcript.dialogue: My dog Tex. (shows another picture)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Oh, he's a big boy!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Be a man, Space Ghost!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You're right, you're right...

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Of course I'm right! Now get out there and show me something!

transcript.speaker: Merrill Markoe
transcript.dialogue: Winky. (shows another picture)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Hey, Winky! What about Bo?

transcript.speaker: Merrill Markoe
transcript.dialogue: That's right, I don't have a picture of Bo. Do you know Bo?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: I know all about you, Merrill.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (bounds to desk) Hey woman, my dinner ready yet? No? Well then, go iron my jeans!

transcript.speaker: Merrill Markoe
transcript.dialogue: I think you're starting to offend me now.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: This is how we men are, Merrill, so get used to it!

transcript.speaker: Merrill Markoe
transcript.dialogue: Are you kind of simple-minded?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Huh?

transcript.speaker: Merrill Markoe
transcript.dialogue: You are about the most annoying talk show host I've ever dealt with, and I've dealt with them all.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Oh, yeah? Well, you're the guest who was a whole lot funnier the last time she was on!

transcript.speaker: Merrill Markoe
transcript.dialogue: And how do you expect me to keep up any kind of energy or mood or anything with you being that rude?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: But I'm supposed to be rude! I'm your lover!

transcript.speaker: Merrill Markoe
transcript.dialogue: And now you're telling me I'm not funny. You're telling me I was funnier before?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Hey...

transcript.speaker: Merrill Markoe
transcript.dialogue: And I'm not as funny now.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Hey...

transcript.speaker: Merrill Markoe
transcript.dialogue: What do you want from me?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Hey hey hey hey hey hey hey HEY!

transcript.speaker: Merrill Markoe
transcript.dialogue: Well?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Come over here and give me a kiss.

transcript.speaker: Merrill Markoe
transcript.dialogue: Hm?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Plant one on me. You know you want to.

transcript.speaker: Merrill Markoe
transcript.dialogue: Oh, don't you start. Don't you even try.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, right. Now come on!

transcript.speaker: Merrill Markoe
transcript.dialogue: I would find that...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Delightful?

transcript.speaker: Merrill Markoe
transcript.dialogue: ... dangerous and repellant. Don't, don't mess with me that way.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Here, I'll make it easy for ya. (scoots up close to monitor, makes kissing noises)

transcript.speaker: Merrill Markoe
transcript.dialogue: Listen, I think, uh, I, I didn't come here to be insulted by you. And, what do you want from me?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: How about a foot rub?

transcript.speaker: Merrill Markoe
transcript.dialogue: I'm never coming on this show again.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Aaaagh! Moltar! (flies off)

transcript.speaker: Merrill Markoe
transcript.dialogue: I don't even care what planet this is. You'll never see me again.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Where's Adam, you dolt? I need some good advice!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: It's too late for that. Check this out. (throws lever; monitor shows Zorak and merrill together)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (gasps) Zorak!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (whispers to merrill's monitor)

transcript.speaker: Merrill Markoe
transcript.dialogue: Now that you mention it, it is appealing in sort of a dangerous way, yeah. I would, I would like that. Do you mean it, in, in an affectionate way?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (whispers some more)

transcript.speaker: Merrill Markoe
transcript.dialogue: Mmm...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (bounds to desk) What in Gordon's seed is going on in here? Zorak! (aims power bands at Zorak)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Oh! (jumps away from monitor)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (gasps) No!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (evil laugh)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: My pretty pony! Why, Zorak, why? You could have had any woman you wanted! But you chose the woman I love almost as much as I love myself! You ruined my life, you ruined her life, and now, I'm going to ruin your life!!! (blasts Zorak; freeze frame just as blast touches Zorak)

transcript.speaker: John Henson
transcript.dialogue: Never a dull moment on Coast to Coast. Next week join Spacey and friends as they welcome the Tampa Bay Buccaneers. Think they're gonna need a bigger monitor. Right now, let's meet a disgruntled employee who earned a little OT by making the boss's wife scream "oh, me!" Ladies and gentlemen, pre-ops and post-ops, (drum roll) introducing our Talk Soup Clip of the Week!

transcript.speaker: (Zorak seated on Jenny Springer set; crowd jeering noises in background) (screen caption
transcript.dialogue: Jenny Springer - "You Ruined My Life, You Ruined Her Life, Now I'M Going To Ruin Your Life!")

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: I didn't even like her. I just wanted to ruin Space Ghost's life.
